briefTitle: Study of Dovitinib Versus Sorafenib in Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma
officialTitle: An Open-label, Randomized, Multi-center, Phase III Study to Compare the Safety and Efficacy of Dovitinib Versus Sorafenib in Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma After Failure of Anti-angiogenic (VEGF-targeted and mTOR Inhibitor) Therapies
summary: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of Dovitinib versus sorafenib in patients with metastatic renal cell cancer.

primaryOutcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) Per Independent Central Radiology Review
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Until disease progression or discontinuation of treatment due to unacceptable toxicity up to 30-Jun-2014 (discontinuation)
